section.title: Introduction
section.para: You will learn how to register your base product (and additional modules and extensions) after the installation. The registration process can be done either with &yast; or from the command line. Registering your base system and modules and extensions is necessary to get technical support and product updates. All extensions require additional registration codes which are liable for cost.

listitem.para: You have installed your product and your system is up and running.
If you want to register your product at the &scc; center, your system needs to be connected to the Internet.
If you want to register your product at an ⪪ server, the &rmt; server needs to be available within your network.
You or your organization have created a &suse; account at .
You have an e-mail address associated with the &suse; account you or your organization uses to manage subscriptions.
You have a valid registration code for your product.

section.title: Registering your product with &yast; after the installation

step.para: The registration dialog guides you through the registration of your base product and the selection of modules and extensions for your product.
Provide the E-mail address associated with the &suse; account you or your organization uses to manage subscriptions.
Enter the Registration Code you received with your copy of &productname;.
By default the system is registered with the &scc;. Proceed to the next step to make this happen.
If your organization provides local registration servers you can either choose one form the list of auto-detected servers or provide the URL at Register System via local SMT Server.

Choose Next to start the registration process. &productname; is registered with the chosen server and the associated repositories are added to your system. The Extension and Module Selection dialog opens.

Activate at least the preselected modules (Basesystem Module and Server Applications Module, &slewe; and Desktop Applications Module). Also make sure to activate any additional module or extension that you have added during the installation. Proceed with Next.
Depending on your selection, you may need to accept one or more license agreements. All components are registered with the chosen server and the associated repositories are added to your system.

In the last step, the &yast; package installer opens. It shows the release-packages to install for each module. Depending on your choice of modules and extensions, it also shows additional packages preselected for installation. We recommend not to deselect any of the preselected packages. You can search and add additional packages, if needed.
If a module has dependencies on other modules, the modules on which it depends are automatically selected for installation, too.
Choose Accept and Finish to conclude the registration process.

section.title: Registering your product from command line after the installation
section.para: To register the base product plus modules and extensions from the command line, use SUSEConnect. By default, it registers your product at the &scc;. Alternatively, you can choose to register against an &rmt; server by using the --url option.

Replace REGISTRATION_CODE with the registration code you received with your copy of &productname;. Replace EMAIL_ADDRESS with the e-mail address associated with the &suse; account you or your organization uses to manage subscriptions.
This process will register the Basesystem Module and Server Applications Module, &slewe; and Desktop Applications Module and add the associated repositories to your system.
&productname; including the two default repositories is now registered.

section.title: Summary
section.para: After successful registration of a product, the repositories required to keep your product up-to-date have been added to your system.
